description: Multi-Node Well Package Version 2 - Simulates wells that span multiple model layers with intraborehole flow and wellbore skin effects

variables.name: COMMENT
variables.description: Optional comment lines at beginning of file.
variables.tooltip: Lines starting with '#' are treated as comments and ignored by MODFLOW.

variables.name: MNWMAX
variables.description: Maximum number of multi-node wells to be simulated.
variables.tooltip: Maximum number of MNW2 wells in the model. Determines memory allocation.

variables.name: NODTOT
variables.description: Maximum number of nodes (cells) associated with all MNW2 wells. 0=calculate automatically.
variables.tooltip: Total maximum number of well nodes across all wells. If 0 or blank, MODFLOW computes this from well definitions. Only needed if NODTOT must be specified for memory.

variables.name: IPFLAG
variables.description: Flag for printing auxiliary data. Not commonly used.
variables.tooltip: Controls auxiliary variable printing. Typically 0.

variables.name: MNWPRNT
variables.description: Print flag controlling MNW2 output verbosity to the listing file.
variables.tooltip: 0=minimal output. 1=print well data for each stress period. 2=also print node data. Higher values give more diagnostic output.

variables.name: Options
variables.description: Optional keywords: AUXILIARY followed by variable names.
variables.tooltip: AUXILIARY adds additional user-defined variables to each well entry.

datasets.description: Well definition data - properties for each MNW2 well

variables.name: WELLID
variables.description: Unique alphanumeric well identifier (up to 20 characters).
variables.tooltip: Text name identifying this multi-node well. Must be unique among all MNW2 wells. Used for cross-referencing and output.

variables.name: NNODES
variables.description: Number of cells (nodes) associated with this well. If <0, node information is computed from top and bottom screens.
variables.tooltip: If > 0, NNODES nodes are explicitly specified. If < 0, |NNODES| entries define screen intervals and MODFLOW determines intersected cells.

variables.name: LOSSTYPE
variables.description: Well-loss model: NONE, THIEM, SKIN, GENERAL, or SPECIFYcwc.
variables.tooltip: NONE=no well loss. THIEM=Thiem equation (Rw only). SKIN=skin effect (Rw, Rskin, Kskin). GENERAL=general power law (B, C, P). SPECIFYcwc=user-specified cell-to-well conductance.

variables.name: PUMPLOC
variables.description: Pump intake location. 0=top active node, -1=compute, >0=specific node number.
variables.tooltip: 0=pump at first (top) active node. -1=compute optimal location. >0=pump at specified node. Only relevant for multi-layer wells.

variables.name: Qlimit
variables.description: Flag for pumping constraints. 0=no constraint, -1=constrain by head, >0=net recharge is a limiting rate.
variables.tooltip: 0=no pumping rate adjustment. -1=reduce pumping if head drops below specified limit. >0=use a limiting rate.

variables.name: PPFLAG
variables.description: Flag for partial penetration adjustment. 0=no adjustment, >0=adjustment applied.
variables.tooltip: 0=no partial penetration correction. >0=apply partial penetration correction to the Thiem or skin equation.

variables.name: PUMPCAP
variables.description: Number of pump capability (lift-Q) pairs. 0=no pump capacity limitation.
variables.tooltip: If > 0, PUMPCAP pairs of (lift, Q) define the pump capacity curve. Pumping rate is reduced when lift exceeds the pump's capacity.

datasets.description: Well node data - properties per node depending on LOSSTYPE

variables.name: Rw
variables.description: Well radius (L). Required for THIEM, SKIN, and GENERAL loss types.
variables.tooltip: Radius of the well casing or open borehole. Used for Thiem and skin-effect calculations.

variables.name: Rskin
variables.description: Outer radius of the skin zone (L). Required for SKIN loss type.
variables.tooltip: Outer radius of the disturbed zone (skin) around the well. Must be > Rw. Only for LOSSTYPE=SKIN.

variables.name: Kskin
variables.description: Hydraulic conductivity of the skin zone (L/T). Required for SKIN loss type.
variables.tooltip: Hydraulic conductivity of the skin zone material. If < aquifer K, represents positive skin (damage). Only for LOSSTYPE=SKIN.

variables.name: B
variables.description: Linear well-loss coefficient (T/L^2). Required for GENERAL loss type.
variables.tooltip: Linear head-loss coefficient for the GENERAL loss model. Head loss = B*Q + C*Q^P.

variables.name: C
variables.description: Nonlinear well-loss coefficient. Required for GENERAL loss type.
variables.tooltip: Nonlinear head-loss coefficient. Units depend on P. Head loss = B*Q + C*Q^P.

variables.name: P
variables.description: Power for nonlinear well-loss term. Required for GENERAL loss type.
variables.tooltip: Exponent for the nonlinear term. P=2 is the classic turbulent loss model. Head loss = B*Q + C*Q^P.

variables.name: CWC
variables.description: Cell-to-well conductance (L^2/T). Required for SPECIFYcwc loss type.
variables.tooltip: Directly specified conductance between the cell and the well. Only for LOSSTYPE=SPECIFYcwc.

datasets.description: Stress period data for each well

variables.name: ITMP
variables.description: Number of active MNW2 wells for this stress period. <0=reuse previous data.
variables.tooltip: If > 0, ITMP well entries follow with pumping rates. If 0, no MNW2 wells active. If < 0, reuse previous stress period data.
